CatDescriptText: Myriam Joseph, freshman ,Squirrel Hill and Andrew Dixon, freshman, Penn Hills, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 12, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think students in the South are using the right technique in protesting segregation in places of public accommodations?" Myriam Joseph's answer reads: "They have the right to protest.  However, it does not seem to do any good the way they are going about it.  I don't know what would be the best way... The Constitution says that they have these rights and it's only ignorance on the part of others which prevents the attainment of them.  However, I don't think much of the movement because in my opinion, it may create more friction.  There should be some sort of protest, but not en masse.  I believe that it is right and they are equal and due the same rights as anybody."  Andrew Dixon's answer reads: "They're doing all right.  It has taken so long in the courts from 1896 to 1954...They want to move fast, and now this thing is spreading."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Myriam Joseph wearing light colored short sleeved blouse, posed behind table in Cathedral of Learning; Portrait of Andrew Dixon wearing eyeglasses, dark suit jacket, and diagonally striped tie with clip, standing in Cathedral of Learning
